metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1859 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
(1) core/tests/test_memmap.py, (2) core/tests/test_multiarray.py, (3) f2py/f2py2e.py, and (4) lib/tests/test_io.py in NumPy before 1.8.1 allow local users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a temporary file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-numpy - 1:1.8.1~rc1-1
python3-numpy - 1:1.8.1~rc1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-numpy package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.8.1~rc1-1').
